verb.description: Accept or admit the existence or truth of.
examples: the plight of the refugees was acknowledged by the authorities
the government acknowledged that the tax was unfair

verb.description: (of a body of opinion) recognize the fact or importance or quality of.
examples: the art world has begun to acknowledge his genius
he's generally acknowledged to be the game's finest coach

verb.description: Show that one has noticed or recognized (someone) by making a gesture or greeting.
examples: she refused to acknowledge my presence

origin: Late 15th century: from the obsolete Middle English verb knowledge, influenced by obsolete acknow acknowledge, confess.
